newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-India little changed in sluggish day.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-India little changed in sluggish day.

text.p: Most Indian global depositary receipts (GDRs) ended weaker on Tuesday in thin trade with few institutional buyers on the horizon.
"It has been a very quiet day," said one trader.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index JCEAI closed down 0.44 points, 0.71 percent, at 61.08 points, with the premium over the local market at 7.26 percent compared with yesterday's 7.55 percent.
The Bombay Stock Exchange 30-share index fell 24.58 points, or 0.75 percent, to 3,239.94.
Traders said the market had rapidly retraced its gains from the central bank easing of bank reserve requirements and now looked set in for a trading range of 3,000-3,300.
The Capel Korea GDR Index ended off 1.88 points, 2.79 percent, at 65.33, a premium of 28.74 percent over the local market after the Korea Composite Index fell 13.76 points to a provisional 766.32.

The Capel Taiwan GDR Index ended down 1.65 points, 1.88 percent, at 86.14, a premium of 1.39 percent after the Taiwan Weighted Index fell 65.05 points or 1.01 percent to 6,359.67. -- David Chance, London Newsroom +44 171 542 5887
